Sylvest Farms, Inc., Montgomery Facility Risk Management Plan
Executive Summary

The Sylvest Farms, Inc. Montgomery, Alabama plant is a poultry processing facility.  The facility was originally built in the 1960's and through expansions has increased its refrigeration system to where it has more than 10,000 pounds of anhydrous ammonia.  Sylvest Farms has implemented a Process Safety Management program to comply with OSHA regulations and the Risk Management Plan in compliance with the EPA.

Sylvest Farms Senior Management Commitment

Sylvest Farms is committed to safety and allocates resources to accomplish safety goals, for example:

Purchasing safety equipment; hiring a consultant for assistance with safety and environmental matters, having full time safety and environmental managers on staff, conducting safety training for managers, supervisors and employees, training, equipping and maintaining emergency preparedness including a HAZWOPER team providing meeting area and personnel for public meetings.

In addition, the plant?s HAZWOPER team by its training, drills and other preparedness activities has built a strong reputation in the community and public response agencies such as the Montgomery, Alabama Haz-Mat / Fire Department.

Sylvest Farms Ammonia Refrigeration Department

The refrigeration system is operated by a trained full time refrigeration staff that includes 6 Refrigeration Technicians and 1 Refrigeration Superintendent.  The system is regularly monitored, inspected and maintained.  The refrigeration department utilizes preventative maintenance, standard operating procedures, regular and frequent inspections and safety programs.  

Safety procedures include: lockout tagout, hot work permit, hazard communication, ammonia safety, respiratory protection, contractor control, opening system permits, hearing protection, fire prevention and protection, hazardous waste disposal, emergency response and maintenance procedures to ensure the safe operation of the re

frigeration system.

The General Accidental Release Prevention Program and Chemical Specific Prevention Steps

The facility is covered under OSHA 29 CFR 1910.110 Process Safety Management and EPA 40 Part 68 Risk Management Plan for having more than 10,000 pounds of Anhydrous Ammonia.  The release prevention measures and activities are detailed in the PSM program.  In addition, an ammonia refrigeration contractor is utilized to provide maintenance support, improvements and additional maintenance activities beyond the plant?s capabilities as needed.

10. MECHANICAL INTEGRITY
11. HOT WORKS PERMIT
12. MANAGEMENT OF CHANGE

14. EMERGENCY PLANNING AND RESPONSE

18. FACILITY ENTRANCE CONTROL PROCEDURE

The Sylvest Farms, Montgomery, Alabama PSM program has been designed to address the requirements of the Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) Final Rule 1910.119, "Process Safety Management of Highly Hazardous Chemicals." Sylvest Farms, Montgomery, Alabama has designed and structured its PSM program to conform to current Safety and Health Policies, training programs, employee participation practices, vendor-supplied equipment operating and maintenance procedures, and current management policies and practices, and to eliminate excessive re

work of existing safe practices.  The Sylvest Farms, Montgomery, Alabama Process Safety Management program is structured to address future requirements also.

The PSM program includes existing procedures and practices whenever practical and appropriate.  The complete PSM program ensures comprehensive coverage of process areas handling anhydrous ammonia and application of process safety controls.

The concept of Process Safety Management has its roots in solid management practices developed in various process industries.  Management systems are a structured, systematic method to implement an identified set of activities with assigned responsibilities to achieve desired results.  The management systems combine into a PSM program providing organization and application of Sylvest Farms, Montgomery, Alabama government and industry controls, policies, practices, and procedures.

PSM Process And Facility Overview

Sylvest Farms, Montgomery, Alabama operates an ammonia refrigeration system to produce space cooling, product cooling, and process equipment cooling.

The Sylvest Farms, Montgomery, Alabama refrigeration system is designed to provide:

?operating flexibility (through availability of multiple operating equipment combinations);
?economy and efficiency of operations (through the use of operating pressures commensurate with the degree of cooling required and alternative fuel / energy equipment);
?optimal safety performance (through minimal use of ammonia liquid pumps, utilizing instead the pressure differentials established in the system to move liquid refrigerant, detection systems, inspections and alarms); and
?consistency of operation, utilizing programmable logic controllers (PLCs) to monitor, record, operate, and modulate refrigeration equipment as conditions require.

5 Year Accident History

The facility had one accidental release in the past five years.  No one off site was injured and no evacuations were required.    The amount of ammonia released was less t

han 100 pounds.  

After the accident the facility implemented new safety procedures for refrigeration personnel, emergency response plans in the event of a release and engineering controls to prevent a reoccurrence.  These actions included installing additional piping supports where needed, respiratory protection and other PPE during valve operation, additional training for refrigeration system technicians, moving valves to the roof, implementation of an on-site HAZWOPER team, facility evacuation drills, alarms, notification procedures, coordination and emergency response planning with public HAZ-MAT response organizations.

Emergency Response Program

The facility has a trained and equipped ammonia haz-mat team.  The on-site haz mat team has regular re-training and drills.  The Montgomery, AL Fire Department Haz-Mat Team has observed some of the drills at the plant.

Planned Changes to Improve Safety

Planned changes to improve safety include the recent hire of a Safety Director to oversee safety issues at the plant, implementing a new plant safety committee, additional drills for the Haz-Mat Team, continued training of ammonia refrigeration personnel and working with local emergency officials.
